meanings.definition: The act of dividing or partitioning into sections.
meanings.sent1: During the sectioning of the cake, each piece was carefully cut and served.
meanings.sent2: The sectioning of the book into chapters made it easier to follow the story.
meanings.sent3: The sectioning of the puzzle into different parts made it more challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her sectioning of the garden created a beautiful and organized landscape.
meanings.sent5: The sectioning of the map helped travelers navigate through the city more efficiently.

meanings.definition: The process of cutting or separating into distinct parts.
meanings.sent1: The sectioning of the fabric allowed for precise measurements and cuts.
meanings.sent2: Sectioning the hair into layers gave it a more voluminous look.
meanings.sent3: The sectioning of the dough into equal portions made baking cookies easier.
meanings.sent4: His sectioning of the project into smaller tasks helped him manage his time better.
meanings.sent5: The sectioning of the fruit into slices made it easier to share with friends.

meanings.definition: The act of categorizing or organizing into different sections.
meanings.sent1: The sectioning of the documents into folders simplified the filing system.
meanings.sent2: Sectioning the clothes by color made it easier to find matching outfits.
meanings.sent3: Her sectioning of the toys into bins made cleanup time more fun for the kids.
meanings.sent4: The sectioning of the store into departments helped customers locate items quickly.
meanings.sent5: The sectioning of the menu into categories made it easier to decide what to order.
